reviewText: I have seasons 1 and 2(they are great), and as I have been collecting other tv shows of this type, I must say streets is among the best. I look forward to the guest stars as its fun to watch the talented actors.  I also like it because its fun to see who pops up and where. For instance, Leslie Neilsen plays a drunk cop in the first episode. He winds up smashed watching a Salvation Army band perform and goes on a rampage. The kid from "Gentle Ben" appears again and also that young lady from "Escape From Witch Mountain" The episodes he is in are really good, and no he doesn't offer anyone a bite of his half eaten sandwich. The young lady is escaping again, but this time from a wicked step-father. Just another day in the life's of the inspectors.
summary: More and more on the way
Title: N/A

reviewText: We have all waited years for CBS issue Season 3 of The Streets of San Francisco, and it was well worth the wait. I just finished watching Disc 1 of this set and it is top notch! The stories, the guest actors, the audio and video are all terrific. I especially liked the last episode on Disc 1 "Mask Of Death" with John Davidson as a female impersonator serial killer. He was creepy and played the part quite well. The other episodes were great as well. I just never get tired of this show, and CBS has once again done a great job with the audio and video on these discs. I don't know if they just store their reels in caves somewhere with optimum conditions for film, or have the best restorers available. I can never find any flaw with a CBS Video release when it comes to any audio or video aspect. They do an excellent job, just as Stone and Keller do as detectives. I also bought the second Volume to this season, and will watch it once I am done with Vol. 1.  Both volumes of Season 4Streets of San Francisco: The Complete Fourth Seasonare on pre-order, I know the quality will be just as good.
summary: Stone and Keller just keep getting better

reviewText: The Streets of San Francisco (1972 - 1977) was a riveting, well-written detective series, with the combined acting talents of Oscar winners Karl Malden and Michael Douglas, as well as the gorgeous scenery of beautiful San Francisco.  In my opinion, one of the best shows was Mask of Death, which starred John Davidson as the villain (yes, nice Mr. Davidson from Hollywood Squares, but he plays a sensational bad guy ala Norman Bates in Psycho), and can be found on this Season 3 Volume 1 3-DVD set. Below is a list of all the episodes in this set with their featured guest stars alongside:Disc 1One Last Shot - Susan Strasberg, Leslie NielsenThe Most Deadly Species - Brenda Vaccaro, Barry SullivanTarget: Red - Bill Bixby, Linda MarshMask of Death - John Davidson, Herb EdelmanDisc 2I Ain't Marchin' Anymore - Don Stroud, Renne JarrettOne Chance to Live - Joanne Linville, Steven KeatsJacob's Boy - Brock Peters, Dabney ColemanFlags of Terror - Katherine Cannon, Robert HoganDisc 3Cry Help! - Mariette Hartley, Clint HowardFor Good or Evil - Hari Rhodes, Mike EvansBird of Prey - Dennis Cole, Christopher StoneLicense to Kill - Murray Hamilton, Burr DeBenning
summary: Great Streets of SF episode on this Season 3 Vol 1 DVD set

reviewText: This was a great series made greater by the presence of A.) Karl Malden, and B.) a terrific musical score for an opening/closing theme.  Actor Michael Douglas's early entry into Hollywoodland is a serendipitous plus.  A lot of these episodes show a great deal of "topicality" -- that is, the social problems that plagued the 70s form a template for dramatic criminal plots that Lt. Stone and Inspector Keller must deal with.  In this way the show is somewhat of a social "time capsule," but it is interesting because while times change we are still facing many criminal problems today and crime drama is still just as relevant.
summary: Streets of San Francisco; The High Road

reviewText: You know you have a quality show if Quinn Martin's name is attached to it.He had produced "The Untouchables,"The Fugitive,"The Invaders" to name a few. A brilliant cop show  which was hard and gritty at the time with the magnificent Karl Malden and Michael Douglas starring in it. The show ran for five seasons. All to released by CBS/Paramount.This, of course, is season three.Douglas would leave at the beginning of season five to be replaced by Richard Hatch, before his days on Battlestar Galactica,The San Francisco skyline  is used to good effect in this series.Loads of car chases and shoot-outs on these streets.Plenty of guest stars, too,like Richard Egan, Richard Basehart, Joseph Cotton and Henry Darrow adorn this series.A quality series not to be missed.
summary: Q stands for Quality and Quinn Martin Productions

reviewText: Season three of "The Streets Of San Francisco" has finally been released.Today I received my volumn 1 & 2 copies of the dvd set in the mail.Season four is already on pre-order.After purchasing seasons 1 & 2 on dvd around 3 years ago,I honestly did not think any additional seasons of the series would ever be released in my lifetime.This show is one of the best police dramas ever to appear on television,a classic right up there with "Hawaii Five-O".Karl Malden and Michael Douglas work together as partners on this series,and the results are amazing.I was content with having the first 52 episode of the series after buying seasons 1 & 2.I could'nt be happier that CBS/Paramount has released season three,and season four has also been announced as being released later this year as well.This show has not been seen on cable (or) syndicated tv in my area for the past 40 years.I have fond memories of the series as a child.It is a rare treat to obtain the series on dvd.I reviewed all of the season three episodes,and I am happy that CBS/Paramount has done an amazing job on the digital restoration on the show.The video quality/transfer is first rate.It's clear that they took a lot of care in the picture quality of season three,just as they have done in seasons 1 & 2.It's amazing a television show can look so great after nearly 40 years.I hope that the final season (season five),will be released perhaps later this year,and I can have a full series set of this great tv series.Thanks CBS/Paramount for making it all possible.I wish that today's television shows could be this great.Although sadly,they don't compare to this series.This classic 1970's show will be enjoyed for many years on dvd.

reviewText: It seems like we have waited forever for Paramount to release season 3 of "The Streets of San Francisco" on DVD, but now it arrives in stores on July 3rd, 2012. To me this was probably the best season of the series as it featured some very controversial subject matter and an array of guest-stars that made this year an unforgettable one. Everyone from Mariette Hartley to John Davidson (in a blood-curdling performance as a female impersonator who goes on a killing spree) make appearances.The following is a complete list of the first 12 episodes available on Volume 1 along with their airdates:1. "One Last Shot", Sept. 12, 19742. "The Most Deadly Species", Sept. 19, 19743. "Target: Red", Sept. 26, 19744. "Masked of Death", Oct. 3, 19745. "I Ain't Marchin' Anymore", Oct. 10, 19746. "One Chance to Live", Oct. 17, 19747. "Jacob's Boy", Oct. 24, 19748. "Flags of Terror", Oct. 31, 19749. "Cry Help!", Nov. 7, 197410. "For Good or Evil", Nov. 14, 197411. "Bird of Prey", Nov. 21, 197412. "Liscence to Kill", Dec. 5, 1974There are no bonues features.
